intro: Echinorhyncha manzurii, commonly known as the Manzur's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
